newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Oct 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Oct 28.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page Monday:
- Richard Jewell, who was dismissed as a suspect in the bombing at the Olympic Games in Atlanta, says his reputation has been destroyed by the way the media and the government treated his case.
- U.S. President Billl Clinton's election campaign has begun to focus on women voters, emphasizing issues like health, education and family.
- Both Clinton and his Republican rival have stopped campaigning in Pennsylvania for strategic reasons.
- Clinton has learned to be the head of the country's military and espionage network through trial and error during his four years in the White House.
- Joe Torre still can't believe that his Yankee baseball team won the World Series on Saturday.
